body:
I have attached local-verify-run.gz to the ticket.
It only fails on the known flakey permission ITs.
(It seems that we have tests that tend to fail on slow machines, and also ones that tend to fail on fast ones)
Thanks @jinggou
Thank you @jinggou, +1
@shahrs87 anything from you sir before closing this PR?

> @ksobolew - change looks good. Could you please change the PR and the commit message to include the JIRA number?

@gjacoby126 I don't have a JIRA number. How do I get one?

@ksobolew - our issue tracking system is https://issues.apache.org/jira/ . Unfortunately, public signup for it was recently turned off because of bot problems, but if you request an account at https://selfserve.apache.org/jira-account.html  I or one of the other PMC members can approve you and make you a contributor to the project. (This step's a one-time thing.) 

Then it's just a matter of filing a JIRA ticket and rebasing the PR so that the commit message includes the JIRA number.
@jinggou could you please fix the warnings https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1620/1/artifact/yetus-general-check/output/blanks-eol.txt ?
will merge once done and we have clean jenkins results, thanks
FailoverPhoenixConnectionIT is extremely flakey.

Finally build runs were successful, let me take a look tomorrow.

At high level, IIUC, ParallelScansCollector is going to keep adding scan objects and all places where we use parallel scans, we are going to use this new class. New version of intersectScan is going to include scan boundaries from salt buckets. Is this correct?

> FailoverPhoenixConnectionIT is extremely flakey.

right, by clean results, i meant for "blanks" section only :) 
otherwise i agree, "unit" will likely have some flakes, that's fine.

Yes, that's correct.
ParallelScansCollector just simplifies the messy logic where we had to split the lists at the next entry, and maintain the state in object variables.
I have also consolidated some of the very dispersed logic into fewer places.
@gjacoby126 Done!
(I requested a new account, but then realized that I already have one, so I used that one instead.)
Please make sure that the commit message has the JIRA id in the proper format.

Unfortunately, PHOENIX-6983 cannot be tested without PHOENIX-6984, so either we have to do reviews and commits in two passes, or we need to do it together.
There is a separate PR for PHOENIX-6984 only: #1625

This contains backports of Phoenix-6984 and phoenix-6983, and adds PHOENIX-6959 on top of it.
Phoenix-6959 is specific to 5.1, as it backports some fixes from master.

We need to review these together, or do the reviews and commits on two or three passes.

@lokiore The following JIRA title may be more appropriate or something along these -

"Setting server-side masking config default to false"
@jpisaac I see 2 test failures, one is passing locally and Failover one is failing even without the commit. Can you please take a look. I'll push an empty commit to rerun the tests.

In bunch of tests I have replaced `PHOENIX_JDBC_URL` with `getUrl()` method.
`PHOENIX_JDBC_URL` is evaluated to `jdbc:phoenix:localhost;test=true` which doesn't have zookeeper port number in the URL. It defaults to 2181 which is the default port number. Before the patch in PhoenixTestDriver, we create CQSI object once, cache it in PhoenixTestDriver and all the other calls uses the same CQSI object. But after the patch, we maintain a cache of `ConnectionInfo -> ConnectionQueryServices` within PhoenixTestDriver. To construct the right ConnectionInfo we need the actual zookeeper port number. Thats why we can't use `PHOENIX_JDBC_URL` anymore.
@jpisaac  @tkhurana  Can you review this please?
`FailoverPhoenixConnectionIT.testConnectionWhenActiveZKRestarts` is the only test failing as of now, which I think is a known flapper.
@lokiore I understand they are flappers after talking to @virajjasani @tkhurana, Is there a way to mark them as such?

> @lokiore I understand they are flappers after talking to @virajjasani @tkhurana, Is there a way to mark them as such?

I am not sure if we can do something here other than Ignore which I assume we don't want. maybe some plugin can be added at jenkins like Result Test Analyser or do we already have that @virajjasani !?
One failure is being fixed in #1633
@jpisaac we want this in 5.1 too?
@virajjasani create PR for 5.1 to let tests run :- https://github.com/apache/phoenix/pull/1634

@jpisaac @virajjasani @tkhurana :- I have to work on 2 more things I have put TODO, but you can start taking a look at PR.
Thanks
latest build results: https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1598/13/PR_20General_20Check_20Report/
@palashc ChildLinkScanTask.java has missing Apache license header
@tkhurana I have added the license.

Hmm.
I think that this may be a limitation of the "unit" test infrastructure.
It would be interesting to see if the using the existing services object in the code works in an integration test, or on a real / sandbox cluster.
surprising that end2end tests were not run https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1607/28/testReport/

I'm pretty sure that the test were run. 
We're just aging them out really quick, because the Jenkins workers have very little disk space.
The final changes will trigger a new CI run.

I can see that there are also quite a few warnings.
I will address (some of) those based on the new CI run.

I took a look at the warnings, they are mostly for existing issues.
I do not plan to fix those, as that would only add more noise to the patch.

@stoty, Thank you for fixing this issue! The PR looks good to me. I wonder if we should rename IndexDataColumnRef to UncoveredDataColumnRef or even IndexUncoveredDataColumnRef to make the code more readable. I will approve this PR when you fix the conflicts and get a full pre checking test run.

Thanks for the review, @kadirozde.

This PR is just for checking the backport to 5.1

The main PR for master is #1639, which I have already rebased, and has a mostly clean CI run (apart from a known flakey.)
Please review that one.

I agree on renaming IndexDataColumnRef.
Should I open a JIRA for that ?
This is the main PR @kadirozde .

> I agree on renaming IndexDataColumnRef. Should I open a JIRA for that ?

Let us do it as part of this Jira.
Pushed the rename to the other PR, @kadirozde .

Thanks for quick review, @kadirozde !

I have initially applied the rename on the wrong PR.
I have fixed that now.

checkstyle warning [here](https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1638/3/artifact/yetus-general-check/output/results-checkstyle-phoenix-core.txt)

is `RoundRobinResultIteratorIT` successful in local run with this patch?
triggered new build https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1622/8/

> 

checkstyle fixed. RoundRobinResultIteratorIT is successful in local run.
That API was added in 1.4
last build was timed out, triggered new one https://ci-hadoop.apache.org/job/Phoenix/job/Phoenix-PreCommit-GitHub-PR/job/PR-1638/6/

@jinggou we don't have PHOENIX-6589 in 5.1 branch, however you could try backporting this to 5.1 branch and as part of the backport, you can also create `MetricsMetadataSource`, `MetricsMetadataSourceFactory`, `MetricsMetadataSourceImpl` etc classes without adding any "schema registry export" related metrics (which were added as part of PHOENIX-6589).
unless there is any objections, i will merge this PR in 24 hr
UpsertSelectIT is successful in local run
Opened PHOENIX-7009 for this
Tracked in PHOENIX-7010

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
Shouldn't we do the same for phoenix-server ?

4.16 is EOL.
Please rebase to the current master to increase the chances of getting reviewed / committed.
The rebased PR for master is #1653
